meanings.definition: Capable of being killed or defeated.
meanings.sent1: The dragon looked slayable as it lay wounded on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The hero knew the monster was slayable with the right weapon.
meanings.sent3: The knight chuckled at the sight of the supposedly slayable beast.
meanings.sent4: The evil sorcerer's power seemed slayable in the face of the hero's determination.
meanings.sent5: The vulnerability of the enemy made it clear that it was slayable.

meanings.definition: Able to be slain or overcome.
meanings.sent1: The final boss in the game appeared slayable after many failed attempts.
meanings.sent2: The challenges ahead seemed daunting but ultimately slayable.
meanings.sent3: The mountain, though steep, looked slayable to the experienced climber.
meanings.sent4: The enemy's defenses were slayable with the right strategy.
meanings.sent5: The task may be difficult, but it is definitely slayable with perseverance.
